data.title: Top 24 Elementor Themes and Templates for 2024
data.meta_description: Feeling lost as you build your WordPress website? Discover the top Elementor themes and templates to kick your design off right (no coding required).
data.text:
Building your WordPress website may seem like an intimidating task.

That's where WordPress themes with strong page-builders come into play — it makes the process of creating an attractive and professional website simple.

Elementor is a page-builder plugin that allows you to create custom layouts and designs for your website with the help of a drag-and-drop interface. Meaning, you can build WordPress websites or landing pages without any coding knowledge.

Elementor comes with a live editor (so you can see your changes immediately) and over 80 design elements. These allow you to add text, images, icons, maps, posts, testimonials, and more with the click of a button.

There are Elementor Themes — which provide you with basic features to design your business's website, blog, or online store — and Elementor Templates — which provide you with layout and design options focused on a specific web page or section of your site.

In this article, we’ll review a list of the best themes and templates for Elementor for your WordPress site to choose from.

To start, let's review some of the best themes for Elementor.

Best Elementor Themes

If you are looking for an attractive theme to complement the page builder functionality of Elementor, consider the following options.

1. Astra Theme

Astra offers a range of pre-built websites, designs, and customization options that require no coding — this way, you can get your site up and running quickly.

It has a large library of pre-built elementor website templates — you can personalize everything from your site's layout to headers to colors and typography. It comes with a variety of page and post layouts plus dozens of widgets and built-in features to enhance your designs.

Best of all, it's extremely lightweight, requiring less than 50kb of resources (almost half or more required by other themes). As a result, it can load in half a second if implemented properly.

2. Ocean WP Theme

OceanWP includes several page templates and a one-click demo installer to make setting up your site a breeze. It’s fully responsive as well as eCommerce, translation, and RTL-ready. OceanWP includes fast page loading, a built-in SEO base, and excellent support.

It also offers extensions that allow you to expand to a full-screen scrolling site, place a cookie notice that complies with GDPR regulations, add pop-ups, and customize your social feeds.

3. Sydney Pro Theme

6. Vault

Vault is a multipurpose Elementor WordPress theme that comes with 50+ pre-built websites for a variety of businesses, from tech to ecommerce to hospitality. A key feature of this theme is the powerful Theme Builder which gives you complete control over your website elements without needing to learn how to code so you can create beautiful and dynamic websites for any purpose.

The theme comes with customizable headers and footers, unlimited color options, custom post types, hundreds of design elements, and an extensive template library. Features like the popup builder, visual form builder, and marketing banners give you even more options to attract and convert visitors.

7. GeneratePress Theme

GeneratePress is a lightweight, performance-focused theme for your WordPress site. It's a secure and stable option with top-tier speeds and no dependencies.

GeneratePress is search-engine optimized (SEO) as well as translation and accessibility-ready. The user-friendly features include color and typography customizations, layout control, plugin compatibility, and hooks and filters.

8. PressMart

PressMart is a modern Elementor WooCommerce theme that makes a great option for any type of eCommerce store.

To help you get started, it comes with 5+ importable designs for different store niches. All of these designs are built with Elementor, which allows for easy customization using Elementor's interface.

Beyond its tight integration with Elementor, PressMart is also packed with useful eCommerce features including product filters, Ajax search, Ajax add to cart, product quick view, frequently bought together cross-sells, and more.

9. Hestia Pro Theme

Hestia Pro is a stylish, one-page WordPress theme that works best for minimalist websites. Hestia Pro’s starter sites offer pre-built designs for you to easily customize. Everything is done within the customizer, and you don't sacrifice speed for this functionality.

It's compatible with WooCommerce — the very popular eCommerce plugin — so you can start selling products almost instantly.

10. Page Builder Framework Theme

Page Builder Framework is a 100% open source theme (you can even find it on GitHub) that is lightning fast and easy to customize. It has a variety of features, from mobile responsiveness to WooCommerce integration.

Page Builder Framework boasts a load time of 100 milliseconds and the premium add-ons offer extras like transparent headers and additional font options.

You'll also have no problem with:

Accessibility - It follows the latest standards and best practices for 100% accessibility.

SEO - It is schema.org ready.

Translations - It is compatible with the most popular multilingual plugins.

Development - You can easily use hooks and filters.

11. Neve Theme

Neve is beginner-friendly and allows you to customize your site’s headers and footers as well as page layouts in seconds. You'll benefit from its key features such as header and footer customizability, a number of layout options, and page builder compatibility.

If you aren’t sure how you want your site to look, there are more than 80 starter websites to choose from, all available for customization.

In addition, this theme is AMP compatible for mobile publishing and has a WooCommerce integration.

12. Potenza Theme

Potenza is a single-page WordPress theme with a drag-and-drop homepage, customizable layout options, and widgets for social media or content. You'll be able to choose among a number of column layouts, custom widgets, parallax modules, and more to make your site truly unique.

You'll find that it's also compatible with SEO and translation plugins, and it is optimized for speed.

13. Rife Theme

Rife is ideal for displaying photography, art, and portfolio work. It comes with a custom slider, post grid layouts for team members or posts, and the Writing Effect Elementor widget.

If you want to open an online shop, it's compatible with WooCommerce. Rife also includes hundreds of gallery and slider widgets to make your website's content eye-catching and engaging.

14. Ashe Theme

Ashe is a free theme ideal for bloggers looking for a modern and minimalist aesthetic. It comes with a featured slider, WooCommerce capability, more than 800 Google fonts, and Contact Form 7.

It allows for multiple authors, making it a good option for larger blogging teams. The responsive design will make it easy for your readers to enjoy your blog content from any device.

15. Gumbo Theme

Podcasting is becoming more and more popular today. That's why an Elementor podcasting theme — like Gumbo — that's compatible with multiple audio sources, only makes sense.

The theme makes it easy to display podcast episodes in a way that encourages your audience to click and listen. Imagine simply inputting your podcast hosting link into the post settings and having the audio bar automatically pull the content in from that feed.

It also has sliders that make it simple for visitors to scroll through your episodes.

16. Rhodos Theme

Rhodos' clean, minimalist design is best suited for professional, business-oriented websites.

With the one-click demo import, you'll be up quickly, and with Elementor's page builder, you'll be designing in no time. Rhodos includes pre-made modules and shortcodes that allow for efficient site customization, and you'll get access to 10 unique skins to kick off your design process.

The Rhodos theme also offers Awesome Fontello and Google Fonts so you can personalize the way your typography looks on throughout your website.

For hotels, hostels, and other lodging businesses, Bellevue is an ideal, user-friendly theme option. You'll have access to more than 40 design elements, 8 full demos, more than 50 modular templates, and an automated installer that sets you up quickly and easily.

The theme is designed to showcase rooms with sliders and call-to-action (CTA) buttons designed to persuade visitors to book rooms and suites.

Bellevue also includes an easy-to-use booking system as well as map functionality so users can easily view your location.

18. YourWay

YourWay is a flexible multipurpose Elementor theme that makes a great option for any type of creator. It offers dozens of importable demo sites across a range of different niches, all of which are built with Elementor.

Beyond that, YourWay bundles in its own enhancements to Elementor, including 70+ custom Elementor widgets, its own tool to design headers and footers with Elementor, and more. These custom widgets include 13+ social media widgets, 10+ post building widgets, 10+ header/footer components, 21+ WooCommerce widgets, and more.

Beyond the enhancements to Elementor, YourWay also comes with other useful tools such as its own built-in Instagram feed tool, along with other helpful social media integrations.

19. Deep Theme

Deep is a theme that works for a wide range of businesses. The theme's popular features include customizable carousels and sliders as well as interactive elements such as social media widgets, Google Maps, and pricing pages.

You'll also get access to more than 160 section templates, more than 160 shortcodes, animation tools, and 29 premium plugins (for free) with the theme. Deep also has multiple layout and design options for you to share your blog with ease.

Next, let's review some of the best Elementor Templates to help you add cool features once your pages are built.

Best Elementor Templates

From blog posts to about pages to contact pages, your WordPress site content will be more cohesive and organized with the help of an Elementor template.

1. Sizzify Template

Sizzify offers custom add-ons and templates and works well with both free and premium WordPress sites.

It's simple to install and works with any themes. Sizzify also includes over ten custom widgets and over 20 plug-and-play page templates.

2. Barista Bluegrass Template

Ready to make a statement? With vibrant, bold fonts and a strong focus on images, the Barista Bluegrass template will make your website stand out from the crowd.

The template is ideal for cafes, restaurants, and bars. It also offers testimonial sliders and pricing tables for your food and drink menus.

3. Elementorism Template

Elementorism is a collection of nearly 40 templates that work effortlessly with Elementor and require no coding knowledge.

Although the Elementorism templates differ slightly, they share crisp, clean layouts that are easy to navigate and read.

4. Alec Template

Alec is ideal for creating custom landing pages for musicians (and all things music-related). It has a full-page background, which you can customize with the drag-and-drop builder.

This page includes parallax scrolling so you can quickly capture your readers’ attention. You can also add content, image galleries, upcoming events, and videos to your site with just a few clicks.

5. Multipurpose Portfolio Template

The aptly named Multipurpose Portfolio template fits a wide range of uses with a minimalist and responsive design.

It also offers customizable widgets, multiple columns, and lazy loading to ensure your pages function quickly and reliably.

Begin Using Elementor Themes and Templates

When you add in any of these themes and templates to your WordPress website, you’ll be able to completely customize your website with ease, all while improving the user experience. So, review the features these themes and templates offer to determine what will work best for your Elementor WordPress website.

Editor's note: This post was originally published in February 2020 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.
